newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks fall across board, close lower.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks fall across board, close lower.

text.p: Pakistani stocks fell across the board to close lower on Wednesday amid worries about renewed U.S. attacks on Iraq and were likely to open lower on Thursday because of the bearish sentiment, dealers said.

The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index fell 24.03 points, or 1.70 percent, to close at a new year-low of 1,388.19. Losers led gainers 194 to 55. Volume jumped to 20 million shares from Tuesday's nine million.
The slide was across the board and did not spare even stable stocks such as Fauji Fertiliser, Pakistan State Oil (PSO) and Engro Chemical, one dealer said.

"There is no positive news to halt the index's slide," dealer Sajjad Mankani said. Concerns about a regional conflict as a result of U.S. attacks on Iraq dragged down the index below the 1,400-point level.
PSO fell 6.00 rupees to 331, Adamjee Insurance 4.75 to 89, Fauji Fertiliser 3.15 to 68.85 and Engro Chemical 1.00 to 140.
